justification: “After the main task, participants completed the Cognitive Reflection Test-2 (CRT-2; Thomson & Oppenheimer, 2016).” This sentence shows that the construct of cognitive reflection was operationalized with the CRT-2 measure.

measured_by: difference between mean likelihood ratings to share true vs. false headlines in the 12-headline sharing task
justification: “Sharing discernment was computed as a participant's mean likelihood of sharing true news headlines minus their mean likelihood of sharing false news headlines.” This specifies how the construct was measured with the headline-sharing task.

measured_by: likelihood ratings to share each of 12 news headlines
justification: “All participants then completed a headline task assessing their sharing intentions for a set of 12 headlines, in which they indicated how likely they would be to share 12 news headlines.” This links the construct ‘sharing intentions’ to the headline-rating instrument.

“In terms of political orientation, 50.0% of the sample thought of themselves as Democrats, 14.8% as Republicans, and 30.1% as independent…” indicating political orientation was gathered through self-report identification.

topic_or_construct: Importance of sharing only accurate information
justification: “Participants were then asked to provide additional information… and the importance they personally placed on sharing only accurate information.” This shows the construct was measured through a direct self-report rating.

measured_by: ratings of likelihood to implement, acceptability, and perceived effectiveness
justification: “To assess whether acceptance of the intervention differed across conditions, we asked participants for their subjective assessment… rating the likelihood that they would implement it…, how acceptable they would find its implementation…, and how effective they thought it was.” This details the measurement of intervention acceptance.
